column4: well, to me it's not "die or live" thing.  i just wanted to try it out!
I can boot and leave the computer on indefinitely
that's the file system i'm using
tried ext3, ext4 and Reiser4 too
well it's a lap and often i leave it on so my im contacts can see me
yeah, i can see you're very technical.  the way i see it, hardware goes obsolete soon
so i try to get my money's worth
jajaj... ok.  No brag but, i change two laps every year.  so i don't worry about that
what hardware are you using?  I'm too much of a noob myself to actually help out, just curious though.
intel dual proc
'round 2 Gigs
3 Gigs RAM
340 hd
I missed the beginning of your conversation, what is the trouble you're having?
well kunji:  i was doing an update using Synaptic and all of a sudden i
here is my paste: http://paste.ubuntu.com/242774/
other'n that.  the os is fine
yeah, I don't know anything about that, something that might be an alternative would be to run the OS off of a flashdrive.
I've tried that as well successfully
but i don't like carrying around an usb stick.  tried off a micro sd card but it didnt work
oh well..
